original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //üîΩrab 'byor / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do // rab 'byor / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they complete the perfection of generosity in all phenomena that are without attributes, without any performance, unobservable, not arisen, and not produced.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom complete the perfection of morality in all phenomena that are without attributes, without any performance, unobservable, not arisen, and not produced, with a mind free from attributes?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / @425a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / @425a *//
translated: Subh≈´ti, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, all phenomena are without signs, without activity, without reference,üîΩwithout origination, and without production.

original: 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: From the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening, with a mind free from signs, they perfect the perfection of morality.

original: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims zag pa med pa lam gyi khongs su chud pa chos nyid kyis thob pa rab tu 'thob ste /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims zag pa med pa lam gyi khongs su chud pa chos nyid kyis thob pa rab tu 'thob ste /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: until he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: With that divine eye that arises from the ripening of karma, he sees all the lord buddhas who are present, living, and teaching in the innumerable, countless, immeasurable world systems of the western direction.

original: de'i mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: de'i mthong ba de ni /
translated: That vision of his will not be exhaustedüîΩuntil he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @428b mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu @428b mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will not waste it.

original: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWith that divine eye that has arisen from the maturation of karma, they see all the lord buddhas who are present, living, and teaching the dharma in the immeasurable, countless, and limitless world systems of the ten directions.

original: de'i mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: de'i mthong ba de ni /
translated: That seeing of theirs

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not waste until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par smin pa las byung ba des steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: With that divine eye that has arisen from the maturation of karma, he sees all the blessed buddhas who are present, live, and remain in the innumerable, countless, immeasurable world systems of the ten directions.

original: de'i mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: de'i mthong ba de ni /
translated: And that vision of his will not be exhausted

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: until he has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsungs pa'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: de lha'i rna ba'i khams rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsungs pa'i sgra thos te /
translated: With his divine ear, which is purified and surpasses the human, he hears the sounds of the buddhas, the blessed ones, and

original: de'i thos pa de'ang ji srid du thos pa des bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i thos pa de'ang ji srid du thos pa des bdag dang gzhan gyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that hearing of his will not be exhausted until he has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: sems kyi rnam pa shes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thugs sems kyis rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam pa shes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi thugs sems kyis rab tu shes te /
translated: By knowing the aspects of mind, they know the minds of those Lord Buddhas.

original: des sems kyi rnam pa shes pa de'ang ji srid du sems kyi rnam pa shes pa des sems can thams cad kyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde sngon gyi gnas rjes @429a *//
analyzed: des sems kyi rnam pa shes pa de'ang ji srid du sems kyi rnam pa shes pa des sems can thams cad kyi don byas par ma gyur gyi bar du chud za bar mi 'gyur ro // de sngon gyi gnas rjes @429a *//
translated: And that knowledge of the aspects of mind does not disappear until they have used that knowledge of the aspects of mind to do what had to be done for all sentient beings.

original: su dran pa'i shes pas sems can de dag gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shes shing /
analyzed: su dran pa'i shes pas sems can de dag gi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shes shing /
translated: ‚ÄúThey know the past and future roots of goodness of those sentient beings by knowing their past lives.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis sems can de dag yang dag par ston to //üîΩyang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis sems can de dag yang dag par ston to // yang dag par skul lo //
translated: They show those roots of goodness to those sentient beings.üîΩThey encourage them.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
translated: They inspire them.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed do //
translated: They delight them.

original: de dag de ltar yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar byas pa rnams kyang khyad par du 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de ltar yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar byas pa rnams kyang khyad par du 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be taught, inspired, encouraged, and brought to delight in that way.

original: zag pa zad pa'i shes pas kyang sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i shes pas kyang sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go /
translated: With the knowledge of the extinction of the defilements, they will establish beings in the fruit of entering the stream.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go /
translated: They will establish them in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu gzhog go /
translated: They will establish them in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu gzhog go /üîΩrang byang chub la rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu gzhog go / rang byang chub la rab tu gzhog go /
translated: They will establish them in arhatship.üîΩThey will establish them in individual enlightenment.

original: byang chub la rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: byang chub la rab tu gzhog go /
translated: They will establish them in awakening.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams dge ba'i chos gang dang gang la mthu yod pa dang de la rab tu gzhog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams dge ba'i chos gang dang gang la mthu yod pa dang de la rab tu gzhog ste /
translated: In the same way, they will establish beings in whatever wholesome dharmas they are able to.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, that is how

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they complete the perfection of morality with a mind free from signs, in all dharmas that are signless, have no doing, are not apprehended, do not originate, and are not produced.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, how is it that

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @429b dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @429b dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they complete the perfection of patience with a mind free from signs, in all dharmas that are signless, have no doing, are not apprehended, do not originate, and are not produced?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang /üîΩmngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du 'di lta ste /
translated: and without production.

original: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gnyis bsgoms te /üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa gnyis bsgoms te / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: From the time they first give rise to the mind of awakening until they sit at the seat of awakening, they cultivate two kinds of patience: the patience of not retaliating against harm and the patience of accepting that phenomena are unborn.üîΩThe patience of not retaliating against harm

original: de'i drung du sems can thams cad yang dang yang 'ongs te /
analyzed: de'i drung du sems can thams cad yang dang yang 'ongs te /
translated: is when all sentient beings come again and again into the presence of a bodhisattva great being

original: gshe zhing mi snyan par brjod de /
analyzed: gshe zhing mi snyan par brjod de /
translated: and insult and abuse them.

original: rdo ba dang / dbyug pas brdegs shing mtshon gyis btab kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
analyzed: rdo ba dang / dbyug pas brdegs shing mtshon gyis btab kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' tsam gyi go skabs kyang mi dbye'o //
translated: Even if they are struck with stones, clubs, and weapons, the bodhisattva great beings should not give rise to even the slightest angry thought.

original: des 'di ltar brtag par byas te /
analyzed: des 'di ltar brtag par byas te /
translated: They should investigate as follows:

original: de la gang la spyo ba dang / mi snyan par bya ba dang / gdab cing  brdeg par bya ba'ang gang yang med /üîΩgang gshe ba dang / mi snyan par brjod pa @430a *//
analyzed: de la gang la spyo ba dang / mi snyan par bya ba dang / gdab cing  brdeg par bya ba'ang gang yang med / gang gshe ba dang / mi snyan par brjod pa @430a *//
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no one to be scolded, insulted, or struck.

original: dang / brdeg pa dang 'debs pa de'ang med cing /üîΩmi dmigs so //
analyzed: dang / brdeg pa dang 'debs pa de'ang med cing / mi dmigs so //
translated: There is no one who scolds, insults, or strikes.üîΩThey are not found.

original: zhes bya bar brtag par bya'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bar brtag par bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni /
translated: This is how it should be understood.üîΩüîΩRegarding this, the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena by bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rtog na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rtog na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena of bodhisattva great beings‚Äù means that when bodhisattva great beings investigate the nature of all phenomena,

original: chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: they do not find even the nature of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa lta ga la yod de //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin dmigs pa lta ga la yod de //
translated: How could the intrinsic nature of phenomena be observed?

original: des de ltar chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: des de ltar chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong bas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
translated: Thus, by seeing the essence of all phenomena, he attains acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir bzod pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bzod pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called ‚Äúacceptance‚Äù?

original: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dang / ye shes mi chod pa'i phyir bzod pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dang / ye shes mi chod pa'i phyir bzod pa ni /
translated: Because afflictions do not arise and wisdom is uninterrupted, it is acceptance.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
translated: It is acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: de bzod pa de gnyis la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzod pa de gnyis la gnas shing bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Abiding in those two acceptances, he perfects the four concentrations.

original: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four immeasurables.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four formless absorptions.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four legs of supernatural power.

original: dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: It perfects the five faculties.üîΩüîΩ

original: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the five powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the seven factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the noble eightfold path.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the three gateways to liberation.

original: @430b mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: @430b mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the superknowledges.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the meditative stabilities.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four fearlessnesses.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do //üîΩbyams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par byed do // byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the four detailed and thorough knowledges.üîΩHe perfects great love.

original: snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: de 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la gnas te /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la gnas te /
translated: He abides in those noble dharmas that are uncontaminated, supramundane, and not shared in common with any ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'phags pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He perfects the noble forms of superknowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa de dag yongs su rdzogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag la gnas te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa de dag yongs su rdzogs nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag la gnas te /
translated: Having perfected those forms of superknowledge, he abides in the six perfections and the five forms of superknowledge.

original: lha'i mig gis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa de dag thams cad mthong ste /
translated: With his divine eye, he sees all the lord buddhas who reside in the innumerable, countless, immeasurable world systems of the eastern direction, who are alive, who are living well, and who are expounding the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag mthong nas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'thob bo //
translated: Having seen those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, he obtains the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de'ang nam bla na med pa yang dpag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de'ang nam bla na med pa yang dpag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: And that recollection of the Buddha of his is uninterrupted until he attains enlightenment, supreme and fully enlightened.

original: de 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa @431a *//
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i chos zag pa med pa @431a *//
translated: He abides in those noble dharmas that are without outflows,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la gnas te 'phags pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la gnas te 'phags pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: that are supramundane, and that are not shared in common with any of the ≈õrƒÅvakas or pratyekabuddhas. Abiding in them, he perfects the superknowledges of the noble ones.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod do //

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la de ltar bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: but he does not apprehend those buddhafields.

original: de sems kyi brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de sems kyi brtson 'grus de lta bu dang ldan pas /
translated: Endowed with such mental perseverance,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin kyang de la chags pa med de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin kyang de la chags pa med de /
translated: he acquires all wholesome states, but he is not attached to them.

original: de chags pa med par sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
analyzed: de chags pa med par sems can rnams kyi don byed cing /
translated: Without attachment he works for the welfare of beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro /
translated: and he goes from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste /
translated: He goes from world system to world system.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul gang dang gang gis rnam par 'phrul par 'dod pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul de dang des rnam par 'phrul te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul gang dang gang gis rnam par 'phrul par 'dod pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul de dang des rnam par 'phrul te /
translated: By whatever miracles and transformations he wishes to perform miracles and transformations, by those miracles and transformations he performs them.

original: me tog gi char dbab pa'am /üîΩspos kyi ngad 'gye ba'am /üîΩ'brug gi sgra bsgrag pa'am /
analyzed: me tog gi char dbab pa'am / spos kyi ngad 'gye ba'am / 'brug gi sgra bsgrag pa'am /
translated: He causes a rain of flowers to fall,üîΩor he causes the fragrance of incense to spread,üîΩor he causes the sound of thunder to be heard,

original: glu dang / rol mo dang / sil snyan gyi sgra bsgrag pa dang / sa bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: glu dang / rol mo dang / sil snyan gyi sgra bsgrag pa dang / sa bskyod pa'am /
translated: or he causes the sound of song, music, and cymbals to be heard, or he causes the earth to tremble,

original: snang ba bstan pa'am /
analyzed: snang ba bstan pa'am /
translated: or by revealing appearances,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams bstan pas rnam par 'phrul te /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams bstan pas rnam par 'phrul te /
translated: or by revealing a world system of the seven precious substances,

original: gang dang gang du gang dang gang sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dag kyang bdag gi lus las 'gyed de /
analyzed: gang dang gang du gang dang gang sems can rnams kyi don du 'gyur ba de dag kyang bdag gi lus las 'gyed de /
translated: I emanate from my body whatever will benefit sentient beings, wherever and in whatever way.

original: sems can rnams kyi don du bar 'ga' bdag las 'gyed do //üîΩbar 'ga' dri zhim po 'gyed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du bar 'ga' bdag las 'gyed do // bar 'ga' dri zhim po 'gyed do //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, sometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant smell.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul smell.

original: bar 'ga' srog gcod @439a *//üîΩpa med pa'i mchod sbyin chen po byed do //üîΩbar 'ga' sems can mtha' yas pa lam ma yin pa nas 'don te srog gcod pa las bzlog go /
analyzed: bar 'ga' srog gcod @439a *// pa med pa'i mchod sbyin chen po byed do // bar 'ga' sems can mtha' yas pa lam ma yin pa nas 'don te srog gcod pa las bzlog go /
translated: Sometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant sound.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul sound.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant touch.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul touch.

original: ma byin par len pa las bzlog go /üîΩ'dod pas log par g-yem pa las bzlog go /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa las bzlog go / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa las bzlog go /
translated: Sometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant taste.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul taste.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant form.

original: phra ma smra ba las bzlog go /üîΩzhe gcod pa'i tshig las bzlog go /üîΩbrdzun du smra ba las bzlog go /
analyzed: phra ma smra ba las bzlog go / zhe gcod pa'i tshig las bzlog go / brdzun du smra ba las bzlog go /
translated: Sometimes I emanate from myself a foul form.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant smell.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul smell.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant sound.

original: tshig bkyal ba las bzlog go /üîΩchags sems las bzlog go /
analyzed: tshig bkyal ba las bzlog go / chags sems las bzlog go /
translated: Sometimes I emanate from myself a foul sound.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant touch.

original: gnod sems las bzlog go /
analyzed: gnod sems las bzlog go /
translated: Sometimes I emanate from myself a foul touch.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant taste.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul taste.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a pleasant form.üîΩSometimes I emanate from myself a foul form.

original: log par lta ba las yongs su 'grol to //
analyzed: log par lta ba las yongs su 'grol to //
translated: and from wrong views.

original: la la la ni /
analyzed: la la la ni /
translated: To some he teaches
